section.title: Processing Expectations
section.p: Code blocks should be displayed verbatim, with all whitespace and line breaks reproduced in the rendered output. The only exception is a single leading line break, which should be stripped by display tools if present.
Code blocks should be displayed in a fixed-width font. Inline markup may cause style variations, but they should not cause a change to a variable-width font.

section.title: Comparison to DocBook
section.p: DocBook contains numerous elements for modeling code in procedural and object-oriented programming languages. Many of these elements can be seen by browsing the content models for the classsynopsis and funcsynopsis elements. Mallard does not attempt to model any programming languages.
